description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition 6  (approved plans)and condition 10 (Car Park) pursuant to planning permission reference PP/2013/3491 21/10/2013 for " Erection of single storey extension with canopies to rear (East) to provide additional classrooms, hall, swimming pool and associated accommodation, canopy extension to North West side of main building  and 5 small ancillary buildings , external alterations to part of existing building, formation of staff car parking area (22 spaces, 2 of which are disabled) at East end of site with access off Vallis Way, alterations and use of existing parking area to provide 20 mini bus parking spaces, provision of hard surfaced play areas and soft landscaping (Deemed Consent)" Variation seeks to remove condition 6 or amended to allow for use of the rear car park 7 days per week and by non school users.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 2559-JW-01 P04 - Existing Location Plan, 2559-JW-002 P02 - Planning, 2559-JW-101 P03 - Proposed Location Plan, 2559-JW-110 P09, Proposed Site Plan, 2559-JW-111 P06 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan, 2559-JW-112 P03 - Proposed Roof Plan, 2559-JW-114 P02 - Proposed Works to Existing Building, 2559-JW-115 P04 -Proposed Outbuildings, 2559-JW-120 P04 - Proposed North East Elevation, 2559-JW-121 P04 - Proposed North West Elevation, 2559-JW-122 P04 - Proposed South East Elevation, 2559-JW-123 P04 - Existing and Proposed South West Elevation, 2559-JW-

124 P04 - Proposed North West Canopy Elevation, 2559-JW-125 P04 - Proposed South West Sectional Elevation, 2559-JW-130 P03 - Proposed Section A-A & B-B Sectional Elevation Through Pool, 2559-JW-131 P03 - Proposed Section C-C Through North West Accommodation, 2559-JW-140 P01 - Proposed Exterior Views, 2559-JW-141 P01 -Proposed Exterior View, P831858/2 - Topographical Survey Sheet 1 of 2, P831858/3 -Topographical Survey Sheet 2 of 2, CB-500-P07 - Illustrative Landscape Masterplan, CB-501 P01 - Access & Security Plan, CB-502 P01 - Illustrative Landscape Section Elevations - Sheet 1 of 2, CB-503 P01 - Illustrative Landscape Section Elevations - Sheet 2 of 2, CB-504 P01 - Landscape Hardworks, CB-505 P01 - Landscape Softworks, CB-506 - External Works - Existing to be Retained Remodelled and Removed. CB-507 P01 - Boundary Section Elevations sheet 1 of 2, CB-508 P01 - Boundary Section Elevations sheet 2 of 2. CB-509-P01 - Western boundary to Mini-bus Parking Area, 423613-500-C - Tracking Plan for Fire Tender, 423613-502-A - Tracking Plan for Refuse Vehicle, 423613-503-A - Tracking Plan for Mini Bus, 423613-504-A - Tracking Plan for Mini Bus, 423613-505-A - Tracking Plan for Large Car, 423613-507-A - Tracking Plan for Fire Tender, 423613-508-A - Tracking Plan for Minibus.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall fully accord with the details approved by permission PP/2013/5694 dated 4 September 2014.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The external lighting scheme for the development shall fully accord with the details approved by permission PP/2013/5732 dated 31 January 2014. No floodlights, permanent or removable, shall be erected on any part of the site at any time without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To provide adequate lighting to the proposed development and protect the living

conditions of neighbouring residential properties, in accordance with policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The roof shall only be used for storing plant equipment, photovoltaic panels and the associated works as shown on the approved plans and shall only be accessed for the maintenance of this equipment. The roof is not to be used for teaching space or any other use unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby residential properties and the safety of users of the school, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 ' Noise & Vibration', policy D6 of the London Plan (2021 and policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012).

| Community use of the school's facilities including the car park, hall, swimming pool or outdoor play areas/ courts for activities not directly associated with a school related event shall be limited to that approved by permission P/2014/5118 dated 9 December 2014. Any other use of the school's facilities for activities not directly associated with a school related event shall be submitted in writing to the Local Authority for approval prior to the commencement of the event with the exception of:
(b)	non-school users of the school swimming pool;
(c)	Trailfinders Rugby Club during the periods specified in condition 10.
Reason: To accord with the terms of the application to allow appropriate community use of
the premises outside of school hours without significant detriment to the amenities of

occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies GG1, GG3, S1, S3, S5 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(e) (g) (j), 1.2(d), 2.10 and 6.2 of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The extension hereby permitted shall be constructed to Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Very Good standard in compliance with the details approved by permission Ref: 181995CND dated 13 June 2018. Following approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the extension element of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies SI1, SI2, SI3 and SI4 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 5.2 of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| The development shall be implemented to fully comply with the energy strategy details approved by permission Ref: PP/2013/5734 dated 15 April 2014.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the extension element of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012).

| Upon final completion of the development and prior to first occupation, suitable devices for the monitoring of the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in the Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| The new car park at the eastern end of the site, including the associated access, disabled parking, the provision of 4 electric charging points and the infrastructure for the future provision of 4 electric charging points, shall be laid out and completed in accordance with the details indicated on the submitted drawings prior to the first occupation of any part of the extension hereby permitted.  This car park shall not be used by more than 22 cars.  This car park shall be used only by:
(a)	the school and, except on weekday evenings or day at the weekend when school events are held, the car park shall be vacated and closed by 18.30 hours;
(b)	non-school users of the school swimming pool;
(c)	Trailfinders Rugby Club between September and May on up to 10 Friday evenings from 18.00 to 22.00 hours and on up to 20 Saturdays from 13.00 to 19.00 hours.

During any use of the school car park by Trailfinders Rugby Club, the Club shall fully steward the car park, ensure gates are left in the open position to prevent unnecessary noise and encourage visitors to leave promptly and quietly.
Reason: To accord with the terms of the application, to provide adequate parking in

conjunction with the use of the school and in the interests of the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies T4, T6, SI1 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(f), 1.1(h), 1.1(j), 1.1(k), 1.2(k) and 2.10 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), and policies 6.13, 7.4 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013). | The cycle parking shown on the approved drawings shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted and shall be thereafter retained and not used for any other purpose except with the prior written permission of the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided in accordance with the Council's standards and to offer a healthy alternative to private motor vehicles in accordance with policy T5 of the adopted London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(f) and (k) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012), and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 6.13 in the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Notwithstanding any documents submitted with this application, no use of the rear school car park other than by the school shall take place until an updated school travel plan has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The school shall achieve at least a bronze STARS accreditation within one year of the first use of the varied conditions hereby permitted. The minimum of a bronze STARS accreditation shall be permanently maintained thereafter.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies T2 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (f) and 1.1(g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026.

| The hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatment along the western boundary (to the rear of Hathaway Gardens) shall be implemented to fully accord development with the landscaping details approved by permission P/2013/5735 dated 28 July 2014. Any trees or other shrubs which within 5 years of planting die, are removed, or become seriously damaged, or diseased, shall be replaced within the next planting season with other of the same species and size, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and amenity of prospective occupiers, and in accordance with policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The tree protection details included within the submitted Arboricultural Impact Assessment shall be in place prior to any other work being undertaken within the site and be retained in place at all times until the development has been completed and the areas so enclosed shall not be used for any form of storage and shall not have their levels altered.

Reason: To secure protection of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which are of amenity and ecological value to the area and to ensure that the development is landscaped in the visual and ecological interests of the area in accordance with policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies G4, G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.

| Any externally audible plant provided in conjunction with the development hereby approved shall demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.
Reason: In the interests of protecting the amenity of staff and students and other visitors

to the site and the occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with policy D14 of the adopted London Plan (2021), policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012), Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration' and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| . The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the Construction Method Statement submitted with the application and any changes to this Statement shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Details of the works to the crown of any trees that may be affected by the movement of construction traffic shall be agreed with the local planning authority.

Reason:  To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers and to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies SI1, T4, T6 and D14  of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
| Security measures, including the closed circuit television, shall comply with the principles of 'Secured by Design'.

Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder to safeguard the school and amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties. In accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1(e) and 1.1(h) of the Ealing adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies LV7.3 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The surface water and foul water drainage scheme for the development shall be implemented to fully accord with the details approved by permission PP/2013/5736 dated 4 February 2014.

Reason: To ensure the drainage measures comply with Thames Water/Environment Agency requirements, and to prevent the increased risk of flooding in accordance with policies 1.1 (e), 1.2 (m) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies SI12 and SI13 of The London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The swimming pool shall only be emptied into the public sewer overnight, or in dry periods and the rate of discharge shall not exceed a flow rate of 5 litres per second.

Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding or surcharging to the public sewer in accordance with policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (m) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026, policies SI12 and SI13 of The London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).and Local Variation policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
